news.title: Trump says government will make deals like Intel stake 'all day long'
news.summary: Trump boasted about the government's new stake in Intel and said he's determined to do more similar deals. Trump: "I'm looking forward to doing more deals like this"

news.title: Nvidia faces Wall Street's high expectations two years into AI boom
news.summary: N Nvidia's business started transforming two years ago, as demand for processors to power AI workloads transformed the chipmaker. Nvidia is now one of the world's largest chipmakers, with a market value of more than $30 billion.

news.title: Keurig Dr Pepper to buy Dutch coffee company JDE Peet's in $18 billion deal
news.summary: Keurig Dr Pepper will split its beverage and coffee units into two separate U.S.-listed firms. After its planned acquisition of Dutch coffee company JDE Peet's, Keurig will split into two companies.

news.title: Evergrande’s $50 billion rise and fall leaves scars on China's property sector
news.summary: "The state-owned developers will end up running the entire industry," Brian McCarthy, managing principal at Macrolens, told CNBC. "The state will be in charge of everything," he said.

news.title: Elon Musk's xAI secretly dropped its benefit corporation status while fighting OpenAI
news.summary: Elon Musk started xAI as a public benefit corporation, but dropped that distinction last year as the company's operations in Memphis, Tennessee were expanding.

news.title: Apple is blowing its chance for AI leadership — but what else would you expect?
news.summary: With AI, anyone playing it safe will get left behind. Apple no longer innovates —instead, it waits. And with AI, any company that plays it safe is going to be left behind too.

news.title: Bitcoin has surrendered the rally. Why it didn’t bounce after a whale unloaded the cryptocurrency.
news.summary: A whale sold a chunk of bitcoin over the weekend, and on Monday, the cryptocurrency was dragging the rest of the sector south. The price of bitcoin was down 1.7% on Monday.

news.title: AI stocks are in a bubble. Why are so many investors refusing to believe it?
news.summary: AI companies are raising prices and alienating users. The stocks are overvalued, analysts say. The AI industry is in a boom-and-bust cycle.

news.title: Are you middle class? No, you’re not. Here’s why.
news.summary: The middle class is dead. Long live the middle class. The middle class has been dead for a long time. It's time for a new generation of middle-class Americans.

news.title: As a nurse, I’ve seen people use their power of attorney to take advantage of their parents. It would chill you to the bone.
news.summary: “Even if someone has millions of dollars in retirement, that won’t keep them from being trapped in the hospital,” he says.
